content.description: Grey low angle start gains a right-facing corner with stemming moves to the anchor.
content.location: Currently the last route on the right end of Brevity. There is also an alternate finish bolted to the right that is a project.

content.description: Climb up the large, detached pillar for two bolts, before stepping right across a small ledge to gain the streaked wall above. Follow crimps and pockets up obvious black streaks to the chains.
content.location: Approx. 150 feet right of Mackerel Sky. Begins on a large, detached pillar before joining the headwall above.

content.description: Climb straight up tan and black streaks to a large flake feature 4-5 bolts up. Traverse around the right side of this feature to an anchor above.
content.location: Begins right of large detached pillar. Right of Winter Quarters.

content.description: Starts on an easy slab that gradually steepens to the base of a steep, gray prow. Work your way to the apex of the prow on water-sculpted dimples (crux) and climb the featured slab above.
A low crux pulling the bulge from bolts 1 to 2, using small crimps and pockets. Then venture straight up the vertical face, and right past a large hole near the top. Shares anchors with Mackerel Sky.
content.location: The lower (left) portion of the Brevity Wall contains four routes grouped together. Punctual As Usual is the third route from the left, and shares an anchor with Mackerel Sky.

content.description: Begins on flakes right of Liahona and ascends the blunt corner/arête above.
content.location: Far right side of Brevity and 8-10 feet right of Liahona.

content.description: Climb through a bulge from bolts 1 to 2 (crux) and follow a path of unique pockets up the vertical face above. Pass a large hole near the top, to a shared anchor with Punctual as Usual.
content.location: The lower (left) portion of the Brevity Wall contains four routes grouped together. Mackerel Sky is the right-most of these routes, or the fourth route from the left. Shares an anchor with Punctual as Usual.

content.description: An easy slab leads to a tan, flaring dihedral. Press and stem your way up the dihedral to an anchor in the black streak above.
Cruxy vertical climbing at the start leads to a nice slab above.
Begin up the crimpy, vertical face leading to some shallow crack and seam features. Trend left near the top to reach the anchor.
content.location: The lower (left) portion of the Brevity Wall contains four routes grouped together. Bergelene is the second route from the left (the furthest left route is an un-finished project).

content.description: While somewhat short in stature, the Brevity Wall offers some quality lines from 5.11 to 5.12. The limestone here is heavily water featured and mostly vertical, providing lots of crimps, shallow pockets and water runnels. The wall faces north and receives all-day shade, with spring and fall being the best times to visit (target temps in Mesquite between 70-90 degrees).
